[color=grey]ENB is a collection of visual effects created by Boris Vorontsov. It overhauls everything from anti-aliasing and depth of field to lighting and water.
It gives Skyrim the eye candy effects it deserves.[/color]
[img]http://i60.tinypic.com/2vakvfo.png[/img]
[color=grey]RealVision is a finely tuned compilation of ENB effects and post processing. Each setting has been hand tweaked to give the most realism at the lowest performance cost.[/color]
[img]http://i61.tinypic.com/dpfxms.png[/img]
[color=grey]Technically, ENB is compatible with every mod on Nexus. However, RealVision is tuned to look good with a particular set of lighting and weather mods. Using any weather or lighting mods beside the ones listed here will result in your game looking weird. All other mods are fine.[/color]
[img]http://i59.tinypic.com/wgoi1.png[/img]
[color=grey]ENB is very GPU intensive. It will most likely be the most FPS hungry part of your game.[/color][/font]
[line]

[center][img]http://i59.tinypic.com/x5sema.png[/img]

[color=yellow][b]video tutorials for installation:[/b][/color]
using Nexus Mod Manager: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K8C8dtMwWM0]english[/url] or [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=56OJHAY94Rs]german[/url]
using Mod Organizer: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7B_YBRkdsjw&feature=youtu.be]english[/url][/center]



[img]http://i59.tinypic.com/25amez4.png[/img]

1. Nexus Mod Manager (NMM) and Wrye Bash users open the Skyrim menu through Steam. Mod Organizer (MO) users run Skyrim Launcher through MO.
2. In the options section, turn off Antialiasing, Anisotropic Filtering, and FXAA. (in the advanced section)
3. In your video driver, set the features from step 2 and Ambient Occlusion (SSAO) to "Application-Controlled" (Nvidia) or "Use application settings" (AMD). Only do this for Skyrim.

[color=grey]Nvidia users look [url=http://img5.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/nvidia1cr4pav712n.jpg]here[/url] and [url=http://img5.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/nvidia2wn2uqvk83d.jpg]here[/url] to see the required driver settings. AMD users will have similar settings.[/color]

[color=grey](If you prefer driver forced Ambient Occlusion (SSAO), you are free to enable it in your videodriver settings, but don't forget to set EnableAmbientOcclusion=false in enbseries.ini in Skyrimfolder after install step 4!)[/color]

[line]
[img]http://img5.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/2recommendedi02vbfswzc.jpg[/img]

Install these mods in [u]this install order[/u] if you want your Skyrim to look like mine:

[color=yellow]And let always overwrite if NMM asks! (say NO to update and YES to install normally)[/color]

Nexus Mod Manager - Tutorial: [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ClqtmSUsFhg]english[/url] / [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0RzsNWbN-DA]deutsch[/url]
Mod Organizer - Tutorials: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53790/?]Mod Organizer ( S.T.E.P. ) Video Tutorials[/url] by Tannin - MO and Gamerpoets - Videos

[color=yellow]>>FPS<<[/color] stands for performance hungry mods!
[color=red]>>FPS<<[/color] stands for very performance hungry mods!

[list]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57353]Optimized Vanilla Textures[/url] by tony971 [color=grey](optional but recommended, start "Texture Installer.exe" in Data folder after installation.)[/color]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/14227]Ruins Clutter Improved[/url] by raiserfx

[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/60220]Verdant - A Skyrim Grass Plugin[/url] by Preeum [color=yellow]>>FPS<<[/color][color=grey](use Dark grass textures - 1K VERSION and set iMaxGrassTypesPerTexure=15 and iMinGrassSize=70 in Skyrim.ini)[/color]

[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/30164]Natural Grass Texture Floor[/url] by emd
[*][color=grey]Now install [/color]RealVision Plant Patch[color=grey] from my optional files to reduce brightness of some oversaturated plants to work with RealVision ENB[/color]

[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/48938]Watercolor for ENB and Realistic Water Two[/url] by paganmetalf [color=grey](strongly recommended to get intended water brightness!)[/color]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59547]Transparent wave spray Retexture for realistic water 2[/url] by Pfuscher aka Zerwas1
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1111/?tab=2&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D1111&pUp=1]optional landscape textures from Pure Waters[/url] by Laast [color=grey](specific landscape textures (HD) for water areas)[/color]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/4805]AOF Detailed Mountains[/url] by AnOldFriend [color=grey](my preference)[/color] [color=yellow]OR[/color] [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/38004]Vivid Landscapes - Rocking Stones and Mountains Parallax[/url] by Aron
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/38497]Vivid Landscapes - Cliffs and Creeks[/url] by Aron [color=grey](also install Rocking Stones and Mountains Parallax - Compatibility Patch if you use his rocks!)[/color]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/43221]Vivid Landscapes - Tundra Moss Revised[/url] by Aron [color=grey](also use its SMIM compatibility patch)[/color]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/44201]Dust Effects[/url] by HHaleyy [color=yellow]OR[/color] [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2636]Finer Dust[/url] by CptJoker
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/836]Realistic Smoke and Embers[/url] by isoku [color=grey](my preference)[/color] [color=yellow]OR[/color] [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/23352]Better embers[/url] by Dragonborn77
[*][color=grey]Now install [/color]Skyrim_Particle_Patch_for_ENB-All-In-One[color=grey] and [/color]Skyrim_Subsurface_Scattering_Patch_for_ENB[color=grey] by mindflux from [url=http://enbseries.enbdev.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=1499]here[/url] or my optional files but do NOT overwrite SMIM, say "No to mod" if NMM asks to overwrite SMIM![/color]
[color=grey]
[/color][color=yellow][/color][color=grey]Recommended mods for Parallax Terrain texture users: (set FixParallaxTerrain=true in enblocal.ini or use them without Parallax like me)[/color][*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61929]Skyrim 2015 Parallax Terrain SPT[/url] by Pfuscher aka Zerwas1 [color=grey](I'm using Pineforrest, Riverbededge, Rivermud, Snow01, Snow02)[/color]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61416]tamu75 Terrain Parallax Textures[/url] by tamu7 [color=grey](I'm using Coast Beach, PineForest02)[/color]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61452]Parallax Fix Project - Landscape[/url] by StasMonster
[color=grey]If you get purple textures on ground --> info from SPT author:
Q: I see purple stuff.
A: Not a vram problem in this case. The Parallax Fix Project mod tries to load a _2.dds file you don't have. I fixed this for myself by using some textures twice. Or you wait till nexus releases more parallax terrain
[/color][/list]
Instead of all the single Vivid Landscapes- mods you can also try [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49344]Vivid Landscapes - All in One[/url] by Aron

--> NOW USE [url=http://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url] to sort your [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SzoyWugzZAw]loadorder[/url] and clean your [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fw3g_N1jcZQ]masterfiles[/url] !
[line]
[img]http://i60.tinypic.com/2ppbqk2.png[/img]

Install in this order:

[list]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/17802]Project Reality - Climates Of Tamriel[/url] by JJC71 [color=grey] (use all default settings and the Dawnguard and Dragonborn patches if using those DLCs)[/color]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27022]Supreme Storms for Climates of Tamriel[/url] by MannyGT [color=grey](optional, but recommended)[/color]
[*][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/39799]Climates of Tamriel - Weather Patch[/url] by prod80 [color=grey](Install as shown [url=http://img5.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/cotpatch10a6li5nqywmg.jpg]here[/url] and [url=http://img5.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/cotpatch10bim6kazorpv.jpg]here[/url])[/color][color=grey]ONLY activate Supreme Storms like second pic if you are using Supreme Storms!!! For the night level, decide by yourself, i'm recommending level 2 or 3.[/color]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63478]True Storms - Thunder and Rain Redone[/url] by fadingsignal [color=grey](select CoT weather patch and if using also Supreme Storms patch during installation like [url=http://www.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/truestorms14cpi7aetbd.jpg]here[/url])[/color]
[color=grey](set Enable=false in [RAIN] section of enbseries.ini for True Storms own raintextures if you prefer it over ENB rain)[/color][*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/15506]Lightning during Thunder Storms[/url] by Minty [color=grey](optional)[/color]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25675]Lightning during Thunder Storms - Climates of Tamriel - Patch[/url] by Minty [color=grey](ONLY if using the main mod of course)[/color]
[/list]
Now decide to go on with Realistic Lighting Overhaul or Enhanced Lights and FX.
These videos will help you with your decision: [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YceSkJgy2gw&feature=c4-overview&list=UU1CSCMwaDubQ4rcYCpX40Eg]Video 1[/url], [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1BlcG2Hp4Go]Video 2[/url].


[color=yellow][size=4]Option A: RLO[/size][/color]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/30450]Realistic Lighting Overhaul[/url] by The Realistic Lighting Team
[i]My preference for realism![/i][color=grey]
[list]
[*]Activate all modules except Adaptive Interiors Vanilla Weathers and Realistic Lighting Weathers! As shown [url=http://img4.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/rlo10tk4uwm1eo.jpg]here[/url] and [url=http://img5.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/rlo4081ol0ancugzk.jpg]here[/url].
[*]Only activate Dawnguard interiors if you are using Dawnguard!
[/list][/color][color=yellow][size=4]Option B: ELFX[/size][/color]
[url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27043]Enhanced Lights and FX[/url] by anamorfus
[i]My preference for atmosphere and my personal favorite![/i][color=grey]
[list]
[*]Install core + enhancer. It's recommended to use exterior module also. Install as shown [url=http://img5.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/elfx10rsoqh1miz.jpg]here[/url].
[*]If you have Dawnguard or Dragonborn DLCs active also install Enhanced Lights and FX Dawnguard and Dragonborn.
[*]If you are using SMIM, do not forget to install the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?]SMIM Meshes from ELFX[/url] optionals!
[/list][/color]
--> NOW USE [url=http://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url] to sort your [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SzoyWugzZAw]loadorder[/url] and clean your [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fw3g_N1jcZQ]masterfiles[/url] !
[line]
[img]http://i61.tinypic.com/2nkt5ht.png[/img]

1. Download [color=red]ENBSeries v0.266[/color] (enbseries_skyrim_v0266.zip) from [url=http://enbdev.com/download_mod_tesskyrim.htm]enbdev.com[/url] and extract it somewhere.

2. Copy [u]d3d9.dll[/u] AND [u]enbhost.exe[/u] from the wrapper folder to Steam/steamapps/common/Skyrim.

3. Download RealVision via your mod manager and install the option of your choice. In last step decide either to use RealVision Installer (recommended) or Manually Installation.

4. NMM and Wrye Bash users go to Steam/SteamApps/common/Skyrim/Data/RealVision_ENB_files.
Mod Organizer users go to Mod Organizer/mods/RealVision ENB (version)/RealVision_ENB_files.

5. Installation of RealVision files

[color=yellow][i]RealVision Installer (recommended)[/i][/color]

[list][*]Run RV_launcher.exe and click on "INSTALL" (NMM/MO-users) or start RV_install.vbe (Wrye Bash-users)
[*]During installation, the ENBoost Configurator will automatically adjust the enblocal.ini.
[*]Now click on "SET INI" in the RV_launcher or start RV_INIeditor.vbe (Wrye Bash-users). It will automatically set the correct values needed for RealVision ENB in your SkyrimPrefs.ini. And no panic, your old file will be saved in "BAK_SkyrimPrefs.ini".
[*]Done!
[/list][color=yellow][i]Manually Installation[/i][/color] To complete the installation, copy all files and folders from "Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim\Data\RealVision_ENB_files" (NMM/Wrye Bash - users) or from "Mod Organizer\mods\RealVision ENB (version)\RealVision_ENB_files" (Mod Organizer - users) to "Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim". Go to Steam\SteamApps\common\Skyrim and adjust enblocal.ini:

[color=grey][MEMORY][/color]
[color=red]ExpandSystemMemoryX64=true[/color] [color=grey][i]<--- If you have 32 bit Windows, set it to "false".[/i][/color][color=red]
ReduceSystemMemoryUsage=true [/color][color=grey][i]<--- enables the ENBoost features to dramatically reduce CTDs.[/i][/color][color=red]
DisableDriverMemoryManager=false [/color][color=grey][i]<--- for AMD users experiencing CTDs even while ENBoost features are enabled.[/i][/color][color=red]
DisablePreloadToVRAM=false [/color][color=grey][i]<--- enabling could potentially help to load a save game which fails to load otherwise but may cause stuttering.[/i][/color][color=red]
EnableUnsafeMemoryHacks=false [/color][color=grey][i]<--- enabling this is generally not safe, but it's a workaround for users experiencing large amount of stuttering.[/i][/color][color=red]
ReservedMemorySizeMb=[/color]XXX [color=grey][i]<--- start with 64, increase in increments of 128 ( 256, 384, 512, ..., 1024 ) until stuttering has ceased. Only use >=512 with at least 3Gb VRAM.[/i][/color]
[color=red]VideoMemorySizeMb=[/color]XXXX [color=grey][i]<--- RAM + VRAM - 2048 (1Gb=1024) if your RAM <= 8Gb. If you have RAM bigger than 8Gb (8192Mb) use VRAM+8192-2048.[/i][/color]
[color=red]EnableCompression=false[/color] [color=grey][i]<--- can reduce stuttering, but at the cost of more RAM usage. It's generally recommended to be disabled on systems with more than 2Gb VRAM.[/i][/color]
[color=red]AutodetectVideoMemorySize=false[/color] [color=grey][i]<-- Because it keeps guessing wrong.[/i][/color]
[color=grey][ENGINE][/color]
[color=red]ForceAnisotropicFiltering=true
MaxAnisotropy=16
EnableVSync=true
AddDisplaySuperSamplingResolutions=false
VSyncSkipNumFrames=0[/color]
[color=grey][LIMITER][/color]
[color=red]WaitBusyRenderer=false
EnableFPSLimit=false[/color]

[color=orange](This is ENBoost. Do not download ENBoost from the Nexus. You already have it!)[/color]

Set these values in SkyrimPrefs.ini located in .../Documents/My Games/Skyrim for NMM/Wrye Bash users
or in .../Mod Organizer/profiles/Default for MO-users:

[color=grey][Imagespace][/color]
[color=red]bDoDepthOfField=1[/color][color=grey] [i]<--- turn it to 0 if you want crystal clear underwater[/i]
[Display][/color]
[color=red]bFloatPointRenderTarget=1[/color][color=grey] [i]<--- IMPORTANT! Without this value, ENB is not working correctly![/i][/color][color=red]
bTreesReceiveShadows=1
bDrawLandShadows=1[/color][color=grey] [i]<--- if you are using a Performance version and got [url=http://img5.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/201401080000o18hgqc7ya.jpg]ugly landscape shadows[/url] then set it to 0[/i][/color][color=red]
bShadowsOnGrass=1
iMultiSample=1[/color][color=grey] [i]<--- turning it to 1 is the same as setting it to off in skyrimlauncher.[/i][/color][color=red]
iMaxAnisotropy=1[/color][color=grey] [i]<--- turning it to 1 is the same as setting it to off in skyrimlauncher.[/i][/color][color=red]
bFXAAEnabled=0[/color][color=grey] [i]<--- turn it to 1 if you prefer Skyrim FXAA, but deactivate EdgeAA in enblocal.ini to avoid too strong blur[/i][/color][color=red]
[/color][color=red]fGamma=1.2400[/color][color=grey] [i]<--- IMPORTANT! This is the in-game brightness RealVision is optimized for! Don't touch the in-game brightness after setting this.[/i][/color]

Set these values in Skyrim.ini located in .../Documents/My Games/Skyrim for NMM/Wrye Bash users
or in .../Mod Organizer/profiles/Default for MO-users:

[Display]
[color=red]ipresentinterval=1[/color][color=grey] [i]<--- this combined with EnableVSync=true in enblocal.ini is important to avoid tearing[/i][/color]

[color=grey]Right click SkyrimPrefs.ini, select "Properties", and check "Read-only" under Attributes.[/color]

6. Start your game using [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]SKSE[/url], it's not recommended to use the SkyrimLauncher anymore except you set your Skyrim.ini and SkyrimPrefs.ini to read-only!

Have fun!


[size=4][color=orange]If you are preferring [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52423]Pure Weather by Laast[/url] over Climates of Tamriel, also try my second ENB: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55829]PureVision[/url][/color][/size]

[line]
[center][size=5][color=red][b]READ THE FAQ AND [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50214/?]SPEED AND STABILITY GUIDE FOR ENB[/url] BEFORE ASKING THE FORUM FOR HELP[/b][/color][/size]
[line]
[img]http://i61.tinypic.com/2m2ibh2.png[/img][/center]


[i]"I don't know what's wrong"[/i]
[color=grey]Does [url=http://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url] say something's wrong?
LOOT 0.6 requires [url=http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/internet-explorer/ie-11-worldwide-languages]Internet Explorer 11[/url] to generate its report. This requirement will go away with LOOT 0.7.
It says that everything's fine? Check the rest of the FAQ, [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/48262/?]Skyrim Crash Compendium[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56894/?]Modding Beginner's Guide[/url].[/color]

[i]"My game crashes (CTD) before I even get to the menu"[/i]
[color=grey]
[list]
[*]First ensure to have correct language in your Skyrim.ini, for example if you are using my optimized ini-files you will have to adjust "sLanguage=ENGLISH" to your in-game used language.
[*]Use [url=http://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url] and let it sort your loadorder
[*]Start [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/?]TES5edit[/url], let everything selected and press OK. TES5edit will give you an error if something (a master) is missing.
[*]If you are a Dawnguard-user: Ensure to have ClimatesOfTamriel-Dawnguard-Patch.esp and CoT-WeatherPatch_DB.esp installed!
[*]After fresh Windows installation you must update your DirectX runtime for DX9, get it from [url=http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=8109]here[/url]. Extract the files and start DXSETUP.exe.
[*]You probably either need [url=http://www.microsoft...ls.aspx?id=8109]DirectX updated[/url] or you installed a mod without installing another mod that it needs. Use [url=http://loot.github.io]LOOT[/url] to find out if it's the latter. LOOT requires [url=http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/internet-explorer/ie-11-worldwide-languages]Internet Explorer 11[/url] to generate its report.
[*]Watch these essential videos![center][youtube]cPwiY7NBVTM#t=77[/youtube] [youtube]SzoyWugzZAw[/youtube][/center]
[youtube]fw3g_N1jcZQ[/youtube][/list][/color][color=grey]
[*]Ensure to NOT activate the CoT-WeatherPatch_DB.esp from prod80's Climates of Tamriel weather patch if you do not use Dragonborn!
[*]Monitoring tools like MSI Afterburner, EVGA Precision, and Rivatuner OSD also cause problems with ENB. Find the FAQ about it for a workaround.
[*]Disable all "Game Booster" programs or similar like Razer Game Booster, try to disable all in background running not needed programs.
[*]Are you using SSME and SKSE 1.7.x? If yes, delete SSME! why? SKSE 1.7.x already includes the mem patch by Sheson and using SSME and the SSME.ini possibly would cause CTDs. Delete all SSME-files and set your SKSE.ini to:[General]ClearInvalidRegistrations=1[Display]iTintTextureResolution=2048[Memory]DefaultHeapInitialAllocMB=1024ScrapHeapSizeMB=384

[/color][color=grey]Still nothing? Try deleting your rendererinfo.txt file.[/color]

[i]"I'm using Mod Organizer and RealVision is not working for me, what should i do?"[/i]
[color=grey]If you're using Mod Organiser and it isnt working, you MUST edit the Skyrimprefs.ini that belongs to Mod Organiser (Not ONLY the one in my documents/skyrim). To do that, press the puzzle button named 'tools', click INI editor and set bfloatpointrendertarget=1 in SkyrimPrefs.ini. ALSO, you NEED to turn off MSAA through SkyrimLauncher on ModOrganiser, not just the standard launcher.

[url=http://i1252.photobucket.com/albums/hh569/Leon360z/Skyrim/iniedit.png]Ini Editor[/url]
[url=http://i1252.photobucket.com/albums/hh569/Leon360z/Skyrim/skyrimprefs.png]SkyrimPrefs.ini[/url]
[url=http://i1252.photobucket.com/albums/hh569/Leon360z/Skyrim/skyrimlauncher.png]Skyrimlauncher[/url]

Run Skyrim launcher and turn off MSAA and Anisotropic filtering in the options. Thanks to Leon360z.[/color]

[i]"The RV_launcher.exe gives me an error and does not start!"[/i]
[color=grey].Net-Framework is needed for the RV_launcher.exe, update it from [url=http://www.microsoft.com/de-at/download/details.aspx?id=30653]Microsoft[/url].
still not working? --> use RV_Install.vbe instead
still not working? --> update [url=http://www.microsoft.com/de-de/download/details.aspx?id=1406]Windows Script Host[/url]
still not working? --> download the single file of your chosen option and copy the files manually to ".../Steam/SteamApps/common/Skyrim"
for NMM/Wrye Bash-users, or to ".../Mod Organizer/mods/RealVision ENB (version)" for MO-users.

btw, the RV_launcher.exe and all the .vbe-files must be in RealVision_ENB_files to work![/color]

[i]"What should be adjusted in the optimized ini-files?[/i]
[color=grey]Skyrim.ini:
sLanguage=ENGLISH ; <--- Change to your in game used language
SkyrimPrefs.ini:
sD3DDevice="NVIDIA GeForce GTX 780" ; <--- Change to your card. Exact info you will find in your RendererInfo.txt.[/color]

[i]"There are blue lines on the edges of roots, roofs or other textures!"[/i]
[color=grey]open enblocal.ini and set EnableZPrepass=false[/color]

[i]"I have performance drop in heavy rain in forest!"[/i]
[color=grey]open enbseries.ini and set:

[RAIN]
Enable=false[/color]

[i]"What happened to Option C Fantasy?"[/i]
[color=grey]I've fully reworked my versions, the technique, the installation process, the settings. Option C is now no separate version, BUT no panic!
During NMM installation, you will find "Fantasy Effects", activate it additional to your selected Option. Option C is now an addon for Opt. A or B!
To adjust the colors, the vibrancy simply open ENB menu during game, in Shader Parameters windows, open EFFECT.txt and adjust vibrancy for Day, Night and Interiors.[/color]

[i]"What setting or level should i use for in-game brightness?"[/i]
[color=grey]Set fGamma=1.2400 in SkyrimPrefs.ini or use RV_Launcher.exe and click on "SET INI", fGamma=1.2400 is the in-game brightess RealVision is optimized for! Don't touch the in-game brightness after setting this.[/color]

[i]"The white text at the top left corner of the screen says the wrong graphics card"[/i]
[color=grey]You either forgot to change the graphicscard in the optimized ini files or you have a buggy driver (probably from an Optimus card). Use the injector version of ENB to get around this.[/color]

[i]"I'm using ELFX and get massive FPS drops in interiors, what should i do?"[/i]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/60603/?]Unofficial Enhanced Lights and FX ELFX_SMIM_ENB fps performance patch[/url] by Skysan4298

[i]"How do I use the injector version of ENB?"[/i]
[color=grey]1. If you have d3d9.dll in your Steam/steamapps/common/Skyrim folder, delete it.
2. Extract the ENBSeries archive and move the files from Injector to Steam/steamapps/common/Skyrim. DO NOT OVERWRITE WHEN ASKED.
3. Set the following values in enbinjector.ini:

[LIBRARY]
LibraryName=enbseries.dll
[TARGETPROCESS]
ProcessName0=skse_loader.exe
ProcessName1=SkyrimLauncher.exe
ProcessName2=tesv.exe

4. Run the ENBinjector.exe.
5. Start your game and enjoy!
[/color]
[color=red]Note: You will have to run ENBinjector.exe before playing your game from now on. I would make a shortcut somewhere.[/color]

[i]"Help, also the injector does not detect my graphics card correctly!"[/i]
[color=grey]try [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/33227/?]Optimus fix[/url][/color]

[i]"I get a warning that bFloatPointRenderTarget isn't set to 1 but it is"[/i]
[color=grey]You edited the wrong ini. The one you were looking for is in Documents/My Games/Skyrim or Mod Organizer/profiles/Default if you're a MO user.[/color]

[i]"Half of the screen is black"[/i]
[color=grey]Set EnableMist=false in enbseries.ini.[/color]

[i]"My sky is black, no clouds, nothing!"[/i]
[color=grey]Disable RCRN!, RealVision is not compatible with other lighting mods than Climates of Tamriel.[/color]

[i]"I crash every X minutes"[/i]
[color=grey]Follow the bug fixing and memory patch sections of the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50214/?]Speed and Stability Guide for ENB[/url].[/color]

[i]"How do I use MSI Afterburner, EVGA Precision, or Rivatuner OSD with ENB?"[/i]
[color=grey]The steps below are for MSI Afterburner but all 3 are based on the same program so the steps will be similar, if not identical.

[list][*]Update and start MSI Afterburner
[*]Switch to the "MSI On-Screen Display Server" window.
[*]Create a new profile for your game and change to it.
[*]Click the big wrench icon to change advanced settings.
[*]Go to General -> Compatibility properties and turn on "Enable compatibility with modified Direct3D runtime libraries".
[/list][/color][i]"The sun is behind a mountain but I still see its reflection in the water"[/i][color=grey]Deal with it. It was the only way to get the sun to reflect in flat areas. Some people have reported that using the injector can fix this.[/color][i]"There are black bars on the top and bottom of my screen"[/i]
[color=grey]You did that. You checked the box for letterbox effect when you ran the installer. If you don't want it, download the optional letterbox effect disabled file.[/color]

[i]"The screen is black but I still hear music"[/i]
[color=grey]You didn't listen when I said that monitoring tools don't like ENB.[/color]

[i]"My game doesn't look like your screenshots or videos"[/i]
[color=grey]Most of my screenshots and videos are made during Climates of Tamriel weather 02d46e, 029e8a, 05b799 or 05b7e7 with a lot of contrast and bright lighting. Force this weather and then compare again.

To force a CoT weather, first open NMM - plugins and find out your HEX loadordernumber of ClimatesofTamriel.esm, as seen [url=http://img5.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/forceweathera3vc8mqbfe.jpg]here[/url]. Remember this code and type "fw [/color][color=red]0C[/color][color=grey]02d46e" in console.[/color]

[i]"I have a dark landscape but it's bright out"[/i]
[color=grey]Set EnableCloudShadows=false in enbseries.ini[/color]

[i]"Underwater is crystal clear"[/i]
[color=grey]You're using Realistic Water Two and forgot to set bDoDepthOfField to 1 in your skyrimprefs.ini.[/color]

[i]"It's too dark inside"[/i]
[color=grey]Increase AmbientLightingIntensityInteriorDay and AmbientLightingIntensityInteriorNight in enbseries.ini.
if you are using Option B, ELFX, try to deactivate the ELFX enhancer or install ELFX without ELFX enhancer.[/color]

[i]"It's too dark outside at night"[/i]
[color=grey]Increase AmbientLightingIntensityNight in enbseries.ini.[/color]

[i]"It's too bright outside"[/i]
[color=grey]Decrease DirectLightingCurveDay in enbseries.ini.[/color]

[i]"I have super blown out brightness as hell..."[/i]
[color=grey]Crossfire and SLI causes issues and problems with ENB, deactivate one card.[/color]

[i]"The sun is too bright"[/i]
[color=grey]Decrease SunIntensity and SunRaysMultiplier in enbseries.ini.[/color]

[i]"The sun is flickering and pulsing"[/i]
[color=grey]open enbsunsprite.fx and in section "Enable / Disable Light Emulation (Flashes or Pulses)" set all values for "#define..." to 0[/color]

[i]"How do i change the Saturation?"[/i]
[color=grey]Option A and B: open ENB menu in game with shift+enter, open "Shader Parameters"-Window for effect.txt and edit "Vibrance" for Day, Night and Interiors. Then save settings.[/color]

[i]"My game looks too pale"[/i]
[color=grey]Set ForceBorderlessFullscreen=false in enblocal.ini or set Brightness=0.65 in enbseries.ini.[/color]

[i]"Any special notes for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/40706/?]OneTweak[/url] users?"[/i]
[color=grey]Funny you should ask. You have to set BWmode to 2 in OneTweak.ini. You can find it in Steam/steamapps/common/Skyrim/Data/SKSE/Plugins or Mod Organizer/mods/OneTweak/SKSE/Plugins if you're a MO user.[/color]

[i]"I can't load up an old save"[/i]
[color=grey]Did you change your uGridsToLoad value? If so, use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/41592/?]Stable uGridsToLoad[/url]. Have you uninstalled a mod since you started playing that game? If so, use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53045/?]Savegame script scalpel[/url]. Also, set EnableFPSLimit=true in enblocal.ini.[/color]

[i]"Why is this wall invisible?"[/i]
[color=grey]You skipped step 1 of installation.[/color]

[i]"Depth of field isn't working"[/i]
[color=grey]If you are using a performance version, that's normal. if you want DoF, set EnableDepthOfField=true in enbseries.ini or in ENB menu in game.
If you are using Full and get no DoF, you should repeat step 1 of installation and ensure you did everything correctly.[/color]

[i]"Depth of field Crossfire FIX"[/i]
[color=grey]To get DoF to work for crossfire users, rename TESV.exe to Oblivion.exe and add "[Loader] RuntimeName=Skyrim.exe" to SKSE.ini. This should get crossfire to use Oblivion profile, but if still having problems with DoF, the lower performance option is to use the acb?p.exe (assassins creed BH) crossfire profile for TESV.exe. Credit goes to [url=http://enbseries.enbdev.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=23&t=509]surenintendo[/url][/color]

[i]"My eyes are black/missing"[/i]
[color=grey]Seriously, no one did step 1? It's step 1.[/color]

[i]"These shadows are too dark"[/i]
[color=grey]"Black shadows" appear when EnableSkyLighting=true is set. To fix it, increase AmbientMinLevel in enbseries.ini or decrease AmbientLightingCurve.[/color]

[i]"Underwater is green"[/i]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/14007/?]Green Water Fix[/url]

[i]"My head and body are different colors"[/i]
[color=grey]Set FixTintGamma=false in enblocal.ini.[/color]

[i]"Skyrim Launcher has stopped working - missing D3x9_43.dll"[/i]
[color=grey]Download and install this: [url=http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=8109]DirectX End-User Runtimes (June 2010)[/url].[/color]

[i]"I have screen tearing but VSync and Limiter are active in enblocal.ini"[/i]
[color=grey]set iPresentInterval=1 in SkyrimPrefs.ini AND EnableVSync=true in enblocal.ini and DISABLE VSync in your driversettings
ENB VSync only works if iPresentInterval=1!
if this does not help try to set VSync to adaptive in your driver.[/color]

[i]"My main menu/loading screens are red"[/i]
[color=grey]Delete RealisticWaterTwo - Waves - Falskaar.ini, skyrim.ini, and skyrimprefs.ini. Repeat step 1 of the installation and then run [url=http://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url].[/color]

[i]"I have [url=http://img5.fotos-hochladen.net/uploads/201401080000o18hgqc7ya.jpg]ugly landscape shadows[/url] using the performance version"[/i]
[color=grey]Set bDrawLandShadows=0 in skyrimprefs.ini or fSpecularLODStartFade=2500.0000, fShadowLODStartFade=3500.0000, fLightLODStartFade=3500.0000, and fshadowbiasscale to 0.750 or 1.000 in skyrimprefs.ini.[/color]

[i]"Purple objects after installing SMIM using Mod Organizer"[/i]
[color=grey]There is a bug in Mod Organizer handling some FOMOD installers like SMIM uses. contact [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1334/?]MO-page[/url] for help.[/color]

[i]"How do I change my save back to uGridsToLoad=5?"[/i]
[color=grey]
[list]
[*]Open Skyrim.ini in your text editor.
[*]Launch Skyrim and load your game save with your custom uGridsToLoad setting.
[*]Alt-tab to your text editor, change uGridsToLoad=5 and uExteriorCellBuffer=36 then save the Skyrim.ini file.
[*]Alt-tab back to Skyrim, open the console, type refreshini and then close the console.
[*]Create a new savegame. I recommend to save indoors to avoid issues.
[/list]
[/color]

1. Install Sheson's memory patch via [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]SKSE[/url] with the following steps:
[color=red]This will not work for pirates. Pirates will not be helped via forums or PM.[/color]
[line]
[list]
[*]Install SKSE 1.7.x according to [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xTGnQIiNVqA]Gopher's video[/url].
[*]Go to Steam/steamapps/common/Skyrim/Data and see if you have a SKSE folder with an SKSE.ini file inside.If you do, add these values to SKSE.ini:[color=grey][/color]
[color=grey][General]
ClearInvalidRegistrations=1
[Display]
iTintTextureResolution=2048
[Memory]
defaultHeapInitialAllocMB=1024
scrapHeapSizeMB=384
[/color][color=grey]
[/color]If you don't have an SKSE.ini file, download and install SKSE ini from [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50214/?]Speed and Stability Guide for ENB[/url].[color=grey]If you use MO and one of your mods supplies its own SKSE.ini file, it will overwrite this one. Add the aforementioned values to that mod's SKSE.ini file. You can find it in Mod Organizer/mods/(your mod)/SKSE/.
[/color][*]If you previously used SSME, delete d3dx9_42.dll and ssme.ini from your Steam/steamapps/common/Skyrim folder.
[*]Delete [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/46465/?]Safety Load[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/33526/?]ShowRaceMenu Precache Killer[/url] if you have them installed. They're not needed once the memory blocks are configured correctly.
[*]Download and install [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50471/?]Memory Blocks Log[/url].
[*]Go to the Windhelm docks and pick a fight with a guard. This is pretty much the most memory intensive thing you could do and will max your usage.
[*]NMM/Wrye users go to Skyrim/Data/SKSE/Plugins/.
[*]MO users go to Mod Organizer/overwrite/SKSE/Plugins/.
[*]Open up MemoryBlocksLog.log and check to see that the value directly under Block 1 is 512. [color=grey]If it isn't, you've installed SKSE wrong or your SKSE.ini is getting overwritten (MO users only).[/color]
[*]Check the last number in the Block 1 column. We'll call this value Z.
[*]In SKSE.ini, set defaultHeapInitialAllocMB to (Z + 276.) Do not set lower than 512. [color=grey]MO users that downloaded SKSE ini, this will be in Mod Organizer/mods/SKSE ini/.[/color]
[*]Fight that guard again and make sure that Block 1 is roughly 20 higher than your peak usage. [color=grey]This value may need adjusted over time as you add more texture mods, NPCs, or increase your uGridsToLoad.[/color]
[/list]
[color=grey]
Alternatively, you can use [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50305]SSME[/url]. Blocks must be set using hex values if using SSME.[/color]
